name: Minimal String Xoration
statement: You are given an integer $$$n$$$ and a string $$$s$$$ consisting of $$$2^n$$$ lowercase letters of the English alphabet. The characters of the string $$$s$$$ are $$$s_0s_1s_2\cdots s_{2^n-1}$$$. A string $$$t$$$ of length $$$2^n$$$ (whose characters are denoted by $$$t_0t_1t_2\cdots t_{2^n-1}$$$) is a xoration of $$$s$$$ if there exists an integer $$$j$$$ ($$$0\le j \leq 2^n-1$$$) such that, for each $$$0 \leq i \leq 2^n-1$$$, $$$t_i = s_{i \oplus j}$$$ (where $$$\oplus$$$ denotes the operation bitwise XOR ). Find the lexicographically minimal xoration of $$$s$$$. A string $$$a$$$ is lexicographically smaller than a string $$$b$$$ if and only if one of the following holds: $$$a$$$ is a prefix of $$$b$$$, but $$$a \ne b$$$; in the first position where $$$a$$$ and $$$b$$$ differ, the string $$$a$$$ has a letter that appears earlier in the alphabet than the corresponding letter in $$$b$$$.
inputFormat: The first line contains a single integer $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \le n \le 18$$$). The second line contains a string $$$s$$$ consisting of $$$2^n$$$ lowercase letters of the English alphabet.
outputFormat: Print a single line containing the lexicographically minimal xoration of $$$s$$$.
